impression: Normal cardiac CT angiography. No evidence of coronary artery disease, pulmonary embolism, or aortic dissection. Coronary arteries are patent with normal caliber and course.
findings: Heart: Normal size and position. Left ventricular ejection fraction appears normal. No regional wall motion abnormalities. Coronary arteries: Right coronary artery (RCA) is patent and normal. Left anterior descending (LAD) is patent and normal. Left circumflex (LCX) is patent and normal. No significant coronary artery stenosis. Aorta: Normal caliber and course. No evidence of dissection or aneurysm. Pulmonary arteries: Patent with no evidence of embolism. Lungs: Clear with no evidence of infiltrate, mass, or effusion.
recommendations: No further imaging required at this time. Follow up with cardiologist for continued management of chest pain symptoms.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with clinical presentation and EKG findings.
technique: Cardiac CT angiography performed with retrospective ECG gating. 100 mL Omnipaque 350 IV contrast administered at 5 mL/sec. Images reconstructed at 0.625mm slice thickness.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.

impression: Cervical spine MRI shows mild degenerative changes and small disc protrusion at C5-C6 level.
findings: Cervical spine alignment is normal. Vertebral bodies show mild degenerative changes with small osteophytes. Intervertebral discs show mild desiccation. At C5-C6 level, there is a small central disc protrusion measuring approximately 2mm, which mildly indents the ventral thecal sac but does not cause significant spinal canal stenosis. No evidence of cord compression or myelomalacia. Neural foramina are patent bilaterally. No evidence of fracture, dislocation, or mass lesion.
recommendations: Conservative management recommended. Physical therapy and anti-inflammatory medications may be beneficial. Follow up imaging in 6 months if symptoms persist or worsen.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's neck pain and radicular symptoms.
technique: Cervical spine MRI performed with T1, T2, and STIR sequences in sagittal and axial planes. No contrast administered.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.

impression: Cervical spine MRI in progress - preliminary findings suggest disc herniation at C6-C7 level.
findings: Study in progress. Preliminary images show cervical spine with normal alignment. At C6-C7 level, there appears to be a moderate-sized disc herniation with potential cord compression. Additional sequences being acquired.
recommendations: Complete study and finalize report. Consider urgent neurosurgical consultation if cord compression confirmed.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's neck pain and left arm radiculopathy.
technique: Cervical spine MRI with T1, T2, and STIR sequences. Study in progress.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.

impression: Lumbar spine X-ray shows moderate degenerative changes and mild scoliosis.
findings: Lumbar spine alignment shows mild right convex scoliosis. Vertebral bodies show moderate degenerative changes with osteophyte formation. Intervertebral disc spaces are mildly narrowed at L4-L5 and L5-S1 levels. No evidence of fracture, dislocation, or destructive bone lesion. Facet joints show mild degenerative changes. No evidence of spondylolisthesis.
recommendations: Conservative management with physical therapy and pain management. Consider MRI if radicular symptoms develop or worsen.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's chronic low back pain.
technique: Lumbar spine X-ray AP and lateral views.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.

impression: Stable mammographic findings. No evidence of recurrent malignancy.
findings: Bilateral mammograms show stable post-surgical changes in the left breast from previous lumpectomy. No new masses, calcifications, or architectural distortions. Left breast shows post-surgical scarring and architectural distortion at the lumpectomy site, unchanged from prior studies. Right breast is unremarkable. No axillary lymphadenopathy. Bilateral breast tissue shows scattered fibroglandular density.
recommendations: Continue annual screening mammography. No additional imaging required at this time.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's history of left breast cancer treated with lumpectomy in 2019.
technique: Bilateral mammography with standard CC and MLO views.
comparison: Previous mammogram from 2023 shows stable findings.

impression: Knee X-ray shows post-surgical changes from ACL reconstruction with no acute abnormality.
findings: Right knee X-ray shows post-surgical changes from previous ACL reconstruction. ACL reconstruction hardware is in good position. No evidence of hardware loosening or failure. Joint spaces are well-maintained. No evidence of acute fracture, dislocation, or joint effusion. Mild degenerative changes in the patellofemoral joint. No evidence of loose bodies or calcifications.
recommendations: Continue current treatment plan. Consider MRI if symptoms persist or worsen to assess soft tissue structures.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's history of ACL reconstruction and current knee instability symptoms.
technique: Right knee X-ray AP, lateral, and sunrise views.
comparison: Previous knee X-ray from 2023 shows stable post-surgical changes.

impression: Brain MRI shows focal cortical dysplasia in the right temporal lobe.
findings: Brain MRI shows normal overall brain size and ventricular system. No mass lesions or hemorrhage. In the right temporal lobe, there is focal cortical dysplasia with thickened cortex and abnormal gyral pattern. No evidence of mass effect or midline shift. White matter appears normal. No evidence of demyelination or leukodystrophy. Basal ganglia and brainstem are normal. No evidence of hydrocephalus or Chiari malformation.
recommendations: Neurological consultation recommended. Consider EEG correlation. Follow up imaging in 6 months to assess for progression.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's developmental delay and seizure disorder.
technique: Brain MRI with T1, T2, FLAIR, and DWI sequences in axial, sagittal, and coronal planes. No contrast administered.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.

impression: Thoracic spine MRI shows adjacent segment disease above previous L4-L5 fusion.
findings: Thoracic spine alignment is normal. Vertebral bodies show mild degenerative changes. Intervertebral discs show mild desiccation. At T12-L1 level, there is a moderate-sized disc herniation with mild indentation of the ventral thecal sac. No evidence of cord compression or myelomalacia. Neural foramina are patent. No evidence of fracture, dislocation, or mass lesion. Previous L4-L5 fusion hardware is visible and appears intact.
recommendations: Neurosurgical consultation recommended for evaluation of adjacent segment disease. Consider physical therapy and pain management in the interim.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's persistent back pain after previous fusion surgery.
technique: Thoracic spine MRI with T1, T2, and STIR sequences in sagittal and axial planes. No contrast administered.
comparison: Previous lumbar spine MRI from 2022 shows stable fusion hardware.

impression: Elbow MRI shows mild tendinosis of the common extensor tendon.
findings: Elbow MRI shows normal joint alignment and articular cartilage. Common extensor tendon shows mild tendinosis with increased signal intensity but no evidence of tear. Ulnar collateral ligament is intact. Radial collateral ligament is intact. No evidence of joint effusion, fracture, or mass lesion. Bone marrow signal is normal. No evidence of osteomyelitis or avascular necrosis.
recommendations: Conservative management with rest, ice, and physical therapy. Consider corticosteroid injection if symptoms persist.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's elbow pain and suspected tennis elbow.
technique: Right elbow MRI with T1, T2, and STIR sequences in axial, sagittal, and coronal planes. No contrast administered.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.

impression: Knee MRI shows complete ACL tear with associated bone contusions.
findings: Knee MRI shows complete tear of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) with retracted fibers. Associated bone contusions in the lateral femoral condyle and posterolateral tibial plateau. Medial collateral ligament is intact. Lateral collateral ligament is intact. Posterior cruciate ligament is intact. Menisci appear intact. No evidence of meniscal tear. Joint shows moderate effusion. No evidence of fracture, dislocation, or mass lesion.
recommendations: Orthopedic consultation recommended for ACL reconstruction. Consider bracing and physical therapy in the interim.
clinicalCorrelation: Correlate with patient's acute knee injury during soccer game.
technique: Right knee MRI with T1, T2, and STIR sequences in axial, sagittal, and coronal planes. No contrast administered.
comparison: No prior studies available for comparison.
